I haven't posted anything about this as I wanted to fix up the scenario
converter first :)

Now thats done (found and fixed a bug too!) and it turned out the problem
wasn't with clearing the wrong array lengths but rather the lack of clearing
them at all in the last constructor I wrote for objects, easy 1 line fix,
now the output files are nice and tidy :)

> On thing I have been meaning to suggest for you guys working on the
> new scenario editor is that while one person works on getting the
> graphics to completely work, someone else works on upgrades a scenario
> converter into a full-fledged text-based scenario editor.

Well the other two programmers are busier than me, and I managed to squeze
out my version just before my uni workload returned so now my free time has
dropped quite a bit :)
That means that we don't have the time right now to do it as a team...
I could start working on a fully graphical editor if you want, some
components of my converter were written for reuse and I've got some other
stuff I can drag in to help get the foundations up faster.  It'll just have
to go on my list, about #4 or 5, and right now the top 3 haven't gone
anywhere for the last couple of weeks so it could be quite a while until I
produce something :)

> Another feature I would like to add to the wish list is a sort feature
> for saving the grid files.  It would put all objects that are similiar
> (for example, player 1 positions) all close together to make it easier
> to see where the possible player start positions are.  This would have
> to be done where the player positions stay in the same order they were
> before, but they would all be close together.

Is this for the converter?
I can write the operators needed to run the sorting algorithms over the
objects and sort them some way (I cheated and left out the overloads in the
converter) that could be either hard-coded, or with some work user
specified.

If it's for the final editor well I'm not sure how the current gladiator
editors work though it sounds like you can bring up a list of objects, and
some of those are not displayed graphically.
In the editor we build everything will be graphical, and we can always also
have the option of viewing the object list in a window.

Regardless yes it can be sorted.  I don't think the game cares much about
where objects are in the list, or if there can be speed gains from sorting
them a specific way (Tom?) so it should be ok.

Thats all from me,
Deathifier
